Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Singing as if he were the dolls in his office] Christmas tiiiime is heeeere! [Normal voice] Wow. Thanks guys, that sounded amazing. Hi, I'm Andy Bernard and I am the first office Santa ever to make holiday wishes come true.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who's excited to get their holiday wishes?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Holiday wishes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's that, Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We know exactly what holiday you're referring to.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It is important to be mindful of all belief systems at our holiday party.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I've been here eighteen years and have suffered through some weird thematic Christmases. A Honolulu Christmas, A Pulp Fiction Christmas, A Muslim Christmas, Moroccan Christmas. Mo-rocca Christmas. I don't want it. Christmas is Christmas is Christmas is Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I got Stanley tickets to see Lewis Black for his birthday. ...Might not have been the best idea.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't want no Kwanza wreath, I don't need a dreidel in my face, that's it's own thing. And who's that black Santa for?! I don't care! I know Santa ain't black! I could care less. I want Christmas! Just give me plain baby Jesus, lying in a manger, Christmas!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What is the status on my wish?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fulfilled! Brought my bicycle, so I can be your designated driver later. In the event that you drink to much, which is by no means required.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about my wish that we don't have to attend meetings that degrade our sense of adulthood?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That, I cannot do, but I did get you an acre of property on the moon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where? Dark side or light side?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Light side.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is it by the Sea of Tranquility?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: As a matter of fact, yes. Directly adjacent....beachfront.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, who's wish is next? Oh, what about Santa's wish? My biggest wish is that you all get along well with Jessica....C'mon guys, Jessica?...Jim, tell 'em who Jessica is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's not your grandmother, is she?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ugh! Gam-gam's name is Ruth, Jim, you should know. I introduced you on speakerphone that time?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jessica is my super serious girlfriend, who is seriously awesome and seriously sexy. Only thing that's not serious, by the way? Our repartee.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's great. When you know you know. Hey, what's Ruth's deal, man?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Totally out of your league. So in summation, ho ho ho, please be nice to Jessica and mistletoe is not an excuse for sexual assault, and don't go near Gam-gam.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I love Jessica, and I haven't even met her yet. It's like we don't even need to meet, you know? I already love you. Stay home.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I just want you to know that I will be mean to Jessica if you want me to be.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh no, no. It's fine, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's really no problem. I was already planning on being mean to her.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's OK, I don't want you to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [laughing] Hello, ah. Merry Christmas, Erin. Kelly, Happy Pancha Ganapati.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Eww, what is that?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The five day Hindu celebration in December honoring the god Ganesh, Patron of the Arts.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, man.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hey! [Kevin embraces Robert in a tight hug] Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How ya holdin' up...because of your wife leaving you?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I actually appreciate the human intimacy. Feel like a kitten being cradled by a gorilla.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's been ten days since I had sexual intercourse.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well you came to the right place....Ah, this, this party'll cheer you right up.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I hope so. The corporate party was wretched. I am so tired of the Black Eyed Peas. It's rock-n-roll for people who don't like rock-n-roll. It's rap for people who don't like rap. It's pop for people who don't like pop.....ah, heartbreaking. [gestures to Andy in Santa costume]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I hate to have to take my Santa hat off, and put on my hard ass hat. [puts on baseball cap that has a foam rear-end on it with the words "HARD ASS"] But, this is serious. It's come to my attention that somebody who shall remain nameless, wants to switch desk clumps.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine with me. Jim can leave anytime he wants. Goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It wasn't me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It wasn't either of you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kathy wants to leave our clump?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sh sh sh sh! Don't look. Who it was is not important...but she did say that your constant pranking and one-upsmanship is driving her crazy. She or he.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just wanna say, this is not my fault. OK? The weak always bully the strong. Contrary to what you see in the media. I am always acting in self-defense. Occasionally preemptive self-defense. [punches Jim in the arm]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ow, What are you doing? [Jim fights back]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! Respect the hat!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam never seemed to have a problem with us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright. I'm gonna speak in a language you both understand....Mo-nay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Money....You both have sizable Christmas bonuses coming your way. If I catch either of you messing with the other, I will give both bonuses to the other person.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, absolutely not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You need consequences. OK? I want you both walking on eggshells.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Hi. I'm Jessica. I'm looking for Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Jessica. Yes. We don't say hi, we hug. [gets up and hugs Jessica] I'm Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh! [laughs] Oof!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry, hi, I hope you feel really welcome, we all want you here.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My ex is meeting my sex....which is always scary, you know? And not just because you think they might talk about your penis...that's just part of it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Jess, Erin, I hope you're not talking about my penis. [laughs and kisses Jessica on the cheek] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey everyone! I want you to meet Jessica, she is an assistant cross country coach at Bryn Mawr.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin, by the way, amazing receptionist.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh, that's great. Backbone of the office.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Which is funny, actually, because my spine is a mess.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Scoliosis. Had to wear a back brace for three years but I never did. [Jessica laughs, Erin exaggerates back curve]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh no.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Ah..[laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ut oh, it's kicking in. Spontaneous scoliosis.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Spontaneous scoliosis. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This thing could take your arm off, your head off, you know, just exercise caution.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, and um there's a Christmas party upstairs tonight, wanted to tell you about.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Isn't that just for popsicles?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Popsicles?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah, upstairs people? Cause you got a stick up your butt?

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Ah! See, I, I, I thought it was because they're so rich they could all eat popsicles all the time. [laughs] I, in my, I...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well you should definitely come. The foreman always comes. Plus it's fun, you know cookies, smoked fish, alcohol, people acting stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: You had me at "clookies." I can't wait to find out what they are.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: What should I wear?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, it's nice, it's real nice. People get dressed up.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: I will look so handsome for you, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah...[sees Dwight's wallet and open email] I'm gonna s- [see's Dwight watching from break room]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight really wants my bonus. He's trying to entrap me. Oh god, now I can't drink at this thing....I get really pranky when I drink.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Erin, what can I get for you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh, do you have cola? Kirkland if you have it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Now why would you come to a bar and ask for a cola when you can get some from the kitchen? Did some small part of you want something a little stronger? Ryan, Kevin, Phyllis, Oscar, come and take these shots!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The fifth one is for you, Erin. You could take it or leave it. To take it would be to accept that you're at a party and you're an adult woman, with an adventurous spirit. To leave it would be fine too.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: One, two three! [group takes shots]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: OK. [takes shot, group laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Mmm. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whoo! Jiminy Christmas!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Jiminey Christmas indeed.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hit 'er up.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Uh, yeah. I just got my replacement credit card...you want the number? Oh it's uh four seven nine three, zero zero three two, three three one three. The security code is nine two seven. OK great. Thank you very much. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So Dwight did take the bait. He used my credit card numbers to send a two hundred dollar bouquet of flowers, to my wife...from me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughing] Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: But look, it's Christmas, so you're allowed...[Val walks in dressed very formally] whoa, hello. Um, you're allowed to do...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Good cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I meant dressed up compared to normal. You usually dress like a ghost-buster.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I thought you'd wear a sweater.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Since when does a sweater mean "dressed up"? Am I your grandson?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on, stay, alright? It's good for people to get to know you.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: As a contestant on Dancing with the Stars, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [imitating Stanley] I want.. my sugar free cookie, and then I want a sugar cookie. [group laughs] and then I want my nap!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's right. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whoo! [group laughs] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: She, she is remarkable.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Edgy impressions.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How many drinks have you had tonight? I can't be driving everybody home.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A thousand.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa! Maybe you should take a break.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [serious] Maybe you should mind your own business. [normal voice] Just kidding!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah! I've been attacked! Oh my god! Oh! Someone put a porcupine in my drawer!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I was just sitting here at my desk and I, I reached into my drawer to grab my toothbrush and some tooth powder and, and all of a sudden I was attacked by this blood thirsty rabid creature!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wonder, in this office, who has access to a porcupine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or who in this office knows that I have access and is trying to set me up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know this sounds a lot like the premise of my latest Chad Flendermen novel. A murder for framing.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Chad Flendermen. Just an easy going black guy, he knows the streets, yet he also went to Oxford. So. Just as comfortable on a motorcycle as he is on Air Force One. Oh and he's also the world's leading Egyptologist.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Toby! Nobody cares about your sex-crazed black detective.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. Women chase him. He misses his wife.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello? Lacerated hand here folks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice try, this is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh is it really? Two separate times you have set me up to believe I was being recruited by the CIA.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Three times.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You see?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, this has your fingerprints all over it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, you've gotta be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Fingerprints can be planted. You know with a severed hand...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Do you think that's what happened? Do you think he used a severed hand?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, you know what? Why don't we just call animal control...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Might wanna run that by Angela cause it's so cute.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. Porcupines don't have souls. They're like dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes, I'm calling from Dunder Mifflin. We have a very rabid porcupine in our office, someone should come pick it up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come down right away!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone]Uh, I don't know, let me ask. [to Dwight] Uh, were you quilled?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I was quilled.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And what's it's name?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Henrietta.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oops. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? ...Alright, get her out of here, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dynamite by Taio Cruz plays in the background]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, guys. I just wanted to say. Come here! I'm so happy you guys are together. OK? [Andy and Jessica laugh] And you both have such beautiful hair.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: [laughs] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I hope you guys get married....and who knows? Maybe at the wedding, I meet someone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And later on tonight, I hope I see you guys kiss. [blows kisses and pushes Andy and Jessica's faces together.] Ah! [laughs] OK, well I'm gonna go do another reverse spit. That's how the cool kids say "get a drink". [blows kisses and dances away]

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: That's uh, that's the girl you dated.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, yeah, she's not always like that. It's um...

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: No, she, she seems fine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, uh, excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yep. [leaves Jessica to talk to Erin] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Have you had anything to eat besides candy canes?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Every martini has an olive.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK...maybe I should make you some oatmeal or something.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't wanna put you out, but if someone's making oatmeal, I'll take a apple cinnamon and a maple brown sugar in one bowl with whole milk.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, I never told you my Christmas wish.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's about you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's not what it should be, it should just be like a trinket or something.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [slurring slightly] It's that I wish Jessica was dead.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You you, wait. You mean you wish she wasn't here or something.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I wish she was in a graveyard! Under the ground...with worms coming out of her mouth.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, you know, you can't say that, OK? That's my girlfriend that you're talking about. You and I are not together anymore. You need to get over it! Take your wish back.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Too late! It's already been wished! And you promised it would come true. You wrote it in an email! So, which one are you? A murderer or a liar? [Andy leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So, there was talk of oatmeal.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You know, don't listen to what anyone is saying. You look like a, a princess.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I swear...

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Did you not...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was too embarrassed! [group laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey guys, sorry to interrupt, I uh, just found this on my desk. [shows picture of Cici with devil doodles] Need to talk to somebody about it. Can you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Is that Cici?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. It is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's awful.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cici is Jim's daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh my god. How could somebody do that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know, I mean the way I see it is you can deface any picture of me, any one, pick one. Not my kid though.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Who did this? Who did this? Do you know who did this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know who did this....Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He should pay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. He is gonna pay. This is fire-able.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's, I mean.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let me just see that one more time. Yep, you know what? I know who my friends are, now. But I shouldn't have got you involved because the truth is, I don't even really care about this picture, it's a little out of focus. It was probably an accident, right? Like...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's no accident.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right. You're right. So maybe it was me who did it...by accident.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll figure it out, get to the bottom of it....Merry merry.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Christmas Time is Here by Vince Guaraldi Trio is playing in the background]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Enough of this garbage. [harshly places boom box on table and hits play] This is Christmas. [Christmas Eve by Trans-Siberian Orchestra plays. Dwight plays air violin/guitar and sings along] Hi-yah!!!!! [gabe, Creed and Nate join in as shots show various gift giving] Yeah!!!! Christmas!!!!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You alright, Santa?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know those movies where two friends are sleeping together and it's like, hey, can they stay friends?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you think two friends who are not sleeping together can stay friends?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Two friends who are not sleeping together, can they remain friends? Yes, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No...I don't, hmm, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: By the way, I'm not gonna mess with you and Dwight's bonuses. I think it's causing more problems. So just be yourselves, have fun, and try not to let it affect your work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. I will definitely do that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, I'll tell Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? You're sitting, and thinking, and it's probably better if it comes from me anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Christmas miracles do happen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. They totally do.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You can't click on these Kardashian links, that's why you have so many viruses.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well help me, OK? Just, uh take...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm trying but you need to-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yo.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Game on.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: On it.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: [group laughing] I don't know what I was thinking, it was awful...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Jessica, did you just fart? [group stops laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And that, is how it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I would like another alcohol.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let's you and I take a walk. Oscar, you're in charge of the bar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What? I haven't bar tended in forever. Oh, never considered myself a mixologist, oh this is daunting. Um, I need a mortar, pestle, muddler..does anyone have any chocolate shavings?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Your heart is broken. So is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: And what?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And you have any advice or anything?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No [laughs] my god.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: ...Help me feel better...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I've been married thrice and each has ended in an acrimonious divorce, I'm not sure I'm the best person to give love advice....I was hoping you were gonna make me feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: When you do your makeup,

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: How long you, does it take usually? Cause...

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Um, it ta-, um it depends.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: .....Chad Flendermen's kryptonite. [Darryl walks up to Toby and Val in a tuxedo]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Whoa. We got a real Clarence Thomas here.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: I'll see you at home?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK great.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: OK

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Bye [kiss]...I still don't get why you can't just call her a cab and pay for it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I would, it just, that wasn't the holiday wish.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Either he drives or I drive. Now I'm drunk and mad.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: OK [laughs] Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK, bye. [helps Meredith off the floor] Alright Meredith,

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thank you Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You bet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank god Erin's getting a ride home with Robert because she is trashed. [laughs] and who better to drive her home than Robert, I mean, what a stand up guy, you know? I mean he's going through a lot, separating from his wife, showing up to the Christmas party in a track suit and a blazer,

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's go, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I know, I'm coming, I'm coming, I'm coming, I'm coming, I'm coming.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hang on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Alright. [Andy opens back of her van, things fall out]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Whoa! My stuff!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What is all that?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's my valuables!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's junk!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: This is my treasures, no they're my treasures!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're a hoarder. My god!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No I'm not, I'm gonna sell it on Ebay! No no no, you be careful. Be careful.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah! My Santa suit's stuck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs while spray painting "Jim is Awesome" on his own car, talks to porcupine in carrier] What are we gonna do with all that bonus money, Henrietta? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Where are we? This ain't my street.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sh, sh, sh, sh, shh.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ah, this is the posh part of town, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wonder what a studio condo would cost in this neighborhood?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Meredith, shut your drunk hole right now.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Erin, it was great fun tonight. Take a few aspirin and a whole lot of water, sleep in in the morning.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you, goodnight.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What are you smiling for? You thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm sure I am not. Let's get you home.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ow! Take it easy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [yawns, "Idiot" is written on his forehead] Ah, man. Ah, fell asleep, took a nap. Hey guys, ah I feel refreshed now. How's it goin?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Took a little nap right next to Jim's desk. I feel so good right now. Mmm, cookies. What's everyone staring at?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh man, I was supposed to tell Dwight something......C'mon, Jim. [shakes head] I got nothin'.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Where can I get a drink? Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, uh. Well, we thought we wouldn't put the alcohol out till 11AM. It's just...common...decency.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Par for the course. Par for the...freaking course. I'll be in the party room having a cookie until 11. Haha! Yule-log.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Not destroyed. No..... Not destructive. Quite...off-kilter, sure. But... that's too vague. [long pause] Erratic. Darkly erratic. [laughs awkwardly] That's my mood.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Cake?...You seem a little down.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I am. [laughs] I'm a mess.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: How about I fix you some warm milk with some bourbon?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh, that sounds nice.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Maybe watch a movie...under a blanket...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Lovely. Wait, where is this taking place?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: The Murphy bed of my basement.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What...is happening to me? [pause] The lines in your haggard face are paths that lead nowhere. Your hair is the fire of hell. [hugs Meredith] I sincerely hope you find a sexual partner tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's come to my attention that someone, who shall remain nameless, wants to switch desk clumps.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cathy wants to leave our clump?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't look. Who it was is not important...but she did say that your constant pranking and one-upsmanship is driving her crazy. She or he.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Enjoy your new clump.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's so much closer to the bathroom, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry it didn't work out. Hope you find what you're looking for.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: No, I just have more room.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You'll be fine over there.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [talking loudly] Sorry guys, Jim! This package came for you, do you want me to put it on your desk?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That'd be great, thank you. [Erin throws package, it hits Kathy. She thinks it was Jim who threw it]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, I got this bucket from Jim's garage and I filled it with everything disgusting. Except excrement. I can't wait to see the look on his face when that falls on my face. [laughs, then camera shows bucket being dumped on Kathy] Dammit Kathy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: For the past month, I have been collecting wishes from everyone in the office, and I intend to make good on every single one of them.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I see.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now look, I may not have a great laugh like Santa, or a flying sled. But tell you what I do have. A Prius, a heart of freaking gold....

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, you got it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...and an American Express green card.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ryan, for your holiday wish, you wanted ten sick days.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd be satisfied with eight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well I'll do you one better.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Nine?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got you health insurance.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, neat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! Right? But with great perks come great responsibility, so I'm gonna be expecting a lot more from you...no more zoning out in your office.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!
